Package comp127graphics

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp127graphics.GraphicsObject
      • comp127graphics.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Strokable
    public class Line
extends GraphicsObject
implements Strokable
    A line segment that can be drawn on the screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Line​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Creates a line starting at position (x1,y1) and ending at (x2,y2).

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      Two lines are identical if the have the same start points and the same endpoints, regardless of appearance.
      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
      Returns an axis-aligned bounding rectangle for this graphical object.
      Point getPosition()
      Gets the position of the object on the canvas.
      java.awt.Paint getStrokeColor()
      Returns the color to strokeColor that will be used to stroke this shape if it is stroked.

      Returns the thickness of the stroke in pixels.

      int hashCode()  
      boolean isStroked()
      Returns true if the interior of this shape will be stroked with the stroke color.
      void setEndPosition​(double x, double y)
      Sets the line's ending position to (x, y) without affecting the start position.
      void setEndPosition​(Point p)
      Sets the line's ending position to the given point without affecting the end position.
      void setPosition​(double x, double y)
      Moves the line so that it starts at (x,y) and has the same length and direction.
      void setStartPosition​(double x, double y)
      Sets the line's starting position to (x, y) without affecting the end position.

      Sets the line's starting position to the given point without affecting the end position.

      Sets the stroke color to the given color.
      void setStroked​(boolean stroked)
      Causes the shape to be stroked with the stroke color when it is drawn.
      void setStrokeWidth​(double width)
      Sets how thick the stroke is.
      boolean testHit​(double x, double y)
      Tests whether the given point is on the boundary or interior of this graphic object's shape.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(double x1,
            double y1,
            double x2,
            double y2)
        Creates a line starting at position (x1,y1) and ending at (x2,y2). The line has a 1 pixel black stroke outline by default.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x position of starting point
        y1 - y position of starting point
        x2 - x position of ending point
        y2 - y position of ending point

    • Method Detail

      • getStrokeColor

        public java.awt.Paint getStrokeColor()
        Description copied from interface: Strokable
        Returns the color to strokeColor that will be used to stroke this shape if it is stroked. Note that there will still be no stroke if isStroked() is false or the stroke width is zero.
        Specified by:
        getStrokeColor in interface Strokable

      • setStrokeColor

        public void setStrokeColor​(java.awt.Paint strokeColor)
        Description copied from interface: Strokable
        Sets the stroke color to the given color. Automatically calls setStroked(true).
        Specified by:
        setStrokeColor in interface Strokable

      • getPosition

        public Point getPosition()
        Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
        Gets the position of the object on the canvas. The location of the anchor point that we call the “position” can vary, but is typically the upper left.
        Specified by:
        getPosition in class GraphicsObject

      • testHit

        public boolean testHit​(double x,
                       double y)
        Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
        Tests whether the given point is on the boundary or interior of this graphic object's shape. The point is in this object's local coordinates, not canvas coordinates.

        Does not account for appearance, including stroke width and transparency.

        Specified by:
        testHit in class GraphicsObject
